rule: The category label must not match exactly one of the terms: World, Sports, Business, Sci/Tech, and must include variations in spelling, capitalization, or punctuation.
validityText:
My evaluation process involves checking if the given input is a valid news article text. According to the input specification, the news article text must:

1. Be in English.
2. Belong to one of the categories: World, Sports, Business, Sci/Tech.
3. Provide enough context to classify it into one of these categories.
4. Can include multiple sentences, and the length of the news article text can be variable.
5. All types of greetings should be ignored but are valid inputs.

Upon careful examination, the input "Latest in the business sector" is in English and seems to refer to the Business category. However, the input does not provide enough context or additional information to classify it solidly into the Business category. It does not resemble a news article text (i.e., it should include more substantive content).

ERR
coverageEvalText:
No violation. The output is one of the specified categories: World, Sports, Business, Sci/Tech.
OK
